name: Faux-Garou
description: The Faux-Garou is a medium-sized construct mimicking lycanthropic forms, retaining its constructed appearance despite transformations.
memorable: Exhibits remarkable resilience and the ability to frighten enemies with its gaze.
goals: Hunts specific targets identified by its creator, using advanced tracking abilities.
relations: Often associated with its creator, it may be encountered alongside other constructs or creatures of similar purpose.
environment: Typically found in locations tied to its creator or in regions where it may hunt its targets.
strengths: Immunity to many conditions and spells, exceptional durability due to high Constitution and magical weapon augmentation.
weaknesses: Limited intelligence and charisma restrict its tactical abilities and social interactions.
attacks: Employs a Frightening Gaze followed by two deadly claw attacks, dealing slashing and necrotic damage.
most_powerful_ability: Druidic Vengeance, which grants advantage on attacks against specific foes and enhances tracking.
senses: Possesses darkvision up to 60 feet and a passive perception score of 14.
skills: Has a perception bonus of +1, aiding in locating hidden enemies or tracking targets.
additional_information: Does not require air, food, drink, or sleep.
Can change shape into a large or smaller beast matching a lycanthrope's type.
Retains its claws and constructed appearance in any form.
Weapon attacks are magical, adding extra necrotic damage.
Immune to effects that would alter its physical form.
test_queries: monster with a frightening gaze ability
creature that transforms into beast form
